channel.title: CVE Feed for Fibar Group S.A -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Fibar Group S.A -- all products

item.title: CVE-2021-20989|2024-08-03T17:53:23.084Z -- fibar%20group%20s.a -- fibaro%20home%20center
item.description: Fibaro Home Center 2 and Lite devices with firmware version 4.600 and older initiate SSH connections to the Fibaro cloud to provide remote access and remote support capabilities. This connection can be intercepted using DNS spoofing attack and a device initiated remote port-forward channel can be used to connect to the web management interface. Knowledge of authorization credentials to the management interface is required to perform any further actions.

item.title: CVE-2021-20991|2024-08-03T17:53:23.188Z -- fibar%20group%20s.a -- fibaro%20home%20center
item.description: In Fibaro Home Center 2 and Lite devices with firmware version 4.540 and older an authenticated user can run commands as root user using a command injection vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2021-20992|2024-08-03T17:53:23.114Z -- fibar%20group%20s.a -- fibaro%20home%20center
item.description: In Fibaro Home Center 2 and Lite devices in all versions provide a web based management interface over unencrypted HTTP protocol. Communication between the user and the device can be eavesdropped to hijack sessions, tokens and passwords.

item.title: CVE-2021-20990|2024-08-03T17:53:23.099Z -- fibar%20group%20s.a -- fibaro%20home%20center
item.description: In Fibaro Home Center 2 and Lite devices with firmware version 4.600 and older an internal management service is accessible on port 8000 and some API endpoints could be accessed without authentication to trigger a shutdown, a reboot or a reboot into recovery mode.
